website_summaries.verdict: Large-screen TV that gives you the deep blacks and contrast range perfect for movies.
pros: Movies look great with this 65-inch TV thanks to the OLED backlight technology and the deep black colors it produces
HD programming upscaled to fill 4K screen resolution
Includes HDR technology that further enhances the images on the screen, creating bright and realistic colors that you'll love to see
cons: Price is a little higher than expected

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Breakup Television
customer_reviews.text: Everything looks so amazing on this television! It almost made me forget that my heart had recently been stomped on. When I started it for the first time, a soothing woman's voice walked me through the setup and let me know this was the beginning of a very great relationship. No, seriously. She said those words. The sound is very good and the picture is spectacular. I was amazed when I saw the actual screen was half the thickness of my iPhone. If you've recently been broken up with, do it. Buy this TV. You're worth it. You'll love it and it will love you, because it's capable of love, unlike your repressed ex.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Rohr

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, defective unit, worst customer service ever
customer_reviews.text: This TV was great while it worked...but it stopped working on 3/16/2018, 4 months after I purchased it. Dealing with LG customer support trying to get them to honor their warranty is a complete nightmare. They couldn't get a tech out until 3/28, and then gave me the run around for a couple weeks until the finally told me the part to fix my TV was not available, they would not provide a replacement unit, and they were going to reimburse me...AFTER they received the defective unit. Ultimately I did not get my check until 5/22. I am never buying an LG product again...they couldn't care less about their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Funky G Mac Man

customer_reviews.title: Mind blowing Picture Quality and supports all HDR formats
customer_reviews.text: A mind blowing upgrade from my current 32" 1080P LED TV. OLED tech is the future. WebOS is pretty functional and the TV supports every HDR format out there. This TV is the best rated 55" on rtings for a reason - it simply is the best at this price point. If there's one thing I wish this TV had was out of the box Alexa support. However, I was able to get Alexa working using an emulated wemo switch python script I found online.
customer_reviews.author: Does It Work

customer_reviews.title: Massive Burn in after 4000h
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this TV, 55B7, since about one year. It was perfect when i got it, not a single defect, all pixels working, perfect blacks and no issues at all. After heavy use, sometimes 11-12 hours a day, it started to show burn in shadows since we are watching news channels a lot. CNN's red logo and Breaking News are now visible all the time. Did the pixel refresh and all other remedies discussed on AVS to no result. LG is no help and does not see it as a defect. Panel goes back for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Bernd

customer_reviews.title: Xbox One X Users: This TV’s What You’re Looking For
customer_reviews.text: So far, I like this TV a lot. I previously had purchased another brand hoping that it’s 4K support was sufficient for the new Xbox. It wasn’t what I hoped for. Even with Microsoft backing them. After some thorough reviewing, I came across this beauty. While the setup isn’t as seamless (but still smooth and simple!) and the design doesn’t have the flare other brands do, the picture is beautiful. Top notch. HDR compatibility for the Xbox One X is green across the board! This TV is also super thin which is nice whether you’re mounting it or not.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Junkes

customer_reviews.title: One Year Warranty - Dead TV at 14 months
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you get an extended warranty, it does not matter how beautiful the picture is if it does not turn on. I now own an expensive doorstop because they needed to save $0.05 percent on a capacitor on a mother board (just guessing on the part). LG support's web page does not work (you can't finish the form, the submit button just goes back to the top of the page), so this will be fun. I should have bought the Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Glynn Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Definitely awesome TV at this price
customer_reviews.text: Definitely awesome TV at this price. > WebOS is indeed good, has apps for most streaming services including YouTube, Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu and such. > Connects to home NAS, great for viewing family pictures, videos. > Picture quality is great! Cons > Remote buttons tend to not work all the time - often need to press something twice. True for on/off, back, pause/play buttons. > I don't plan to take cable (only stream). The TV defaults to simulated static which is really annoying because it is loud.
customer_reviews.author: Arnab Bose

customer_reviews.title: 2 issues within a year
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 issues with this TV within a year of having it. First issue occurred as soon as i bought the TV. There was a permanent line on the screen that went all the way across. LG is completely useless in there customer service process. It took over a month for a technician to come out diagnose the tv, order a new part, order the wrong part, have to re diagnose the tv and finally fix it. I then had a 2nd issue with the input symbol popping up randomly. LG has done absolutely nothing in their customer service to help with this.
customer_reviews.author: kjohns

customer_reviews.title: TV displays ads that can’t be disabled
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this TV or any other LG TV. For the longest time I thought my Apple TV was showing pop up ads until I discovered that’s it’s actually the TV and there is not way to turn them off. I turned off everything in the user agreement and I still see ads for Chanel plus (which I never enabled). Also there is an annoying delay issue with the optical output. If you are using Sonos or similar it is impossible to correctly sync the sound with the picture. I've tried all the audio sync settings.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Died after a month.
customer_reviews.text: Died after a month. Repeated calls and messages to LG finally resulted in a call back from a repair person. He reported that the neeeded parts were on back order with no stated arrival date. So three months later still sitting with a dead TV and nothing from LG.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Walmsley, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely stunning.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased and returned multiple TVs because they just didn't match up to my 5 year old plasma as far as uniformity, color reproduction and how it handles motion. It's like looking through a window of heaven. Definitely worth it considering the price was only $1,190 when I bought it and will last me for the next 5 years and then some. As far as burn in, it's blown out of proportion. Just make sure you turn Pixel Shift on, cycle through channels every so often and avoid Vivid mode for the first 100 hours of use. If you're looking for a new TV, OLED is much better than LED even with full array dimming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: $87 Square Trade  Won't cover burn in!
customer_reviews.text: Update Burn in burn in burn in Besg Buy covers this but not LG Amazon or Squrare Trade! The picture mysteriously has turned faces in middle of screen green...what a disappointment. Really was a beaut while it lasted will contact to see what if anything can be done. This may have been the deal of the century what an incredibly beautiful television the picture is amazing the blacks are so rich aesthetically it's also a lovely television to look at and let me just tell you I've moved my Sony Soundbar upstairs with my older television set because the sound on this TV is awesome
customer_reviews.author: sheperdess

customer_reviews.title: Triple Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting to be WOW'd by this set. I was not. I was Triple WOW'd. Even after owning three plasmas, I was blown away with the blacks, and the details within. My one complaint, is the presets tend to run too dark, requiring tweaks to OLED Light, Dynamic Contrast and Gamma.Otherwise, this is a beauty to behold. So far, no problems with burn in (running constantly on HBO with OLED Light below 47, to break in), lip sync or banding. Top 2/3's of set is no thicker than an iPhone, and I like the white backside, since I have this placed in front of a white blinded window. Won't stick out on the outside of I open them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Benko

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the budget-friendly Samsung 4K televisions
customer_reviews.text: As of writing this, I've now owned this television for a month, and it's incredible. Way better than the budget-friendly Samsung 4K televisions. The blacks are very black, the picture is crisp, the sound is awesome, and the menus are easy to navigate. The television is a lot lighter than I expected, and doesn't emit as much heat as other televisions. I love the Wii-mote style remote control, where I can use it as a pointer and click things on the screen. The Xbox One and PS4 Pro look gorgeous on it, so if you're looking for a great television for gaming... this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Windham

customer_reviews.title: The most amazing picture I have ever seen
customer_reviews.text: WOW. The picture of this TV when hooked up to proper sources (Apple TV 4k, PS4 Pro) is absolutely INSANE. The picture, the color, it is beyond belief. It is one of those thing where you watch it and realize how and where technology has progressed in this sector. I have been to friends houses with 4k Sony TVs, curved TVs etc. Nothing even close to this TV. The sharpness and clarity of the colors without color bleed is amazing. Super happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Greg-Brain Forza

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture.  OLED rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Wow...just WOW! The picture on this OLED TV is amazing...the darks and blacks, the best we've ever seen even with ambient light in the room. Our slideshows look awesome. Viewing is good wherever you sit. We use it with Apple TV and it's great--but then we have a lot of stuff on our computers that we want to access and view. The LG it is smart on its own and wouldn't really need a separate system. Set up was pretty easy. Everyone who sees it is pretty impressed.
customer_reviews.author: TWA

customer_reviews.title: A picture to die for!
customer_reviews.text: As numerous others have said, this has the best picture that I have ever seen! The picture is so good, it's almost spooky! The WebOS (smart software) is very good and LG updates it regularly. BUT the remote leaves much to be desired. The "Magic" function (wireless point-and-click) works well, and so does the voice-activated function. but the ergonomics are horrible! For instance, the volume up and down buttons are separate bottons, tiny and hard to find in the dark.Much, much less expensive devices have a single rocker switch that glow-in-the-dark. But buy the TV...
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Burn in issue is completely unnacceptable
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for an oled save yourself the anxiety and headache. The picture quality is fantastic but the burn in really sucks. Ever since I heard the reports of burn in on this TV I have babied it. I left a screen share on overnight on accident. There is now a Windows error dialog permanently burnt into my display. I have tried running the pixel refresher to no avail unfortunately. Best part about this is LG explicitly doesn't cover it. The picture quality is not worth the large premium and headache that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eggie

customer_reviews.title: The B.E.S.T.
customer_reviews.text: What ISN'T there to love about this tv? The deep, infinite black it delivers. Or the superlative view from any seat in the room. Picture quality that's crystal clear. Or how about the remote the works like a Wii, and even responds to voice commands? I am happy with this tv in every sense of the word. Only sad that I didn't buy it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality looks very good however something about the TV didn't seem right
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality looks very good however something about the TV didn't seem right. I finally place a level against the edge of the screen and realized that the screen is curved vertically. Currently working with LG on resolving this problem. Will provide an update hopefully in the near future. Anyone else experience this? I'm assuming this is not normal. Perhaps these are now refurbished since it is a 2017 model although the seller did not specify that it was?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OLED is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: After 10 years it was finally time to retire my Pioneer Kuro. The Kuro had the best picture you could buy going back to 2007 and this LG has the best picture you can buy today. I'm blown away with the the inky blacks and colors pop off the screen. It's really a fantastic picture. 4K looks amazing on this set and setup was simple. I'm using ARC to pass audio from the TV back to my Pioneer Elite SC-81 receiver, for steaming content, and this works flawlessly. Highly recommend this set!
customer_reviews.author: atxmoses

customer_reviews.title: The last LG product I will ever buy
customer_reviews.text: Less than 2 years (20 mos) from purchasing this TV this green line appeared. Of course I am out of warranty and it was not something they were able to fix with settings over the phone. I'm not looking forward to taking this to a service center, or being without our main TV, or paying money to have this fixed. I've never had a TV go bad so quickly. I feel like this was quite a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mealey

customer_reviews.title: BURN IN - Trump/CNN Ruined my TV
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I have kept the TV tuned in to CNN during the day for breaking news on the crook in the White House.....because there is almost always breaking news, our TV now has CNN and Breaking News permanently burned-in to the TV. Evidently OLEDs are notorious for this issue.
customer_reviews.author: storrey

customer_reviews.title: Alian technology! Thank you little green men!!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG - there really isn't advancements beyond this. Only negative I can think of is in terms of brightness, then again not really. It's bright enough. Be prepared to turn off soap opera effect. The quality is so much sharper that you need to tune it down a bit. It's just out of this world. My only concern is longevity. At 2k+ if this takes a crap it will be a huge mistake of a purchase. I need 10 years to justify it. My last plasma lasted 5 but I only paid $500 for it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Mazman

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality is to die for!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic picture!! I honestly can't tell the difference from a 4k movie I viewed on Netflix from the HD picture that is broadcast from my Direct TV service. Only negative are the remote control is lacking some features and is not very user friendly. It took over 30' to get a picture back after turning it off once. Have to use 2 remotes to view the TV. Nice thin bezel. There is a scratch on the stand which I'll have to live with- too much trouble to order a replacement. Still pretty heavy at over 50#..
customer_reviews.author: Eugene W. Bricker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had no problem with my old Samsung 4K TV. But this one is just on a different league in terms of picture quality. I watched some colorful movies like "Guardians of Galaxy", and the difference is immediately visible, even for my wife who doesn't pay attention to such details generally. Bottom line? You will know where you extra money went. I didn't pay too much attention to the sound quality, as I opted for a soundbar anyway. But during the set up, I thought that the TV speakers weren't so bad for such thin machine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Yu

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PICTURE, if you haven't seen "true" black, you'll be amazed, Tim, Dallas, TX.
customer_reviews.text: Tv, works, great, past expectation! Can I still get extended warranty? Canceled originally, as I thought it would have to be shipped out of state? Still available, and contact number? newharley2003@yahoo.com
customer_reviews.author: Tim Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great Picture. Love LG TVs
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Easy connectivity into the Comcast-Xfinity universe. Great picture quality, with a bright picture still visible outside of the typical 11-1 o'clock viewing angles. Forms the basis of my home theater system and has since been hooked up to a sound bar and sub-woofer, so I can't really comment on the out-of-the-box sound quality. Very pleased with my purchase - I've had several LG sets over the last 7-8 years and have always been impressed with their quality and longevity. Would buy again and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in the Gig

customer_reviews.title: Best picture you have ever seen.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this TV. The picture is nothing short of amazing and the menu and features are great. It actually took some getting used to when watching UHD 4K content because it is so clear that some movies seem to have lost that cinematic feel, but I am used to it now and appreciate it fully. The Dolby Vision and HDR content is also fun to watch. There is a lot of content on Netflix that looks great on the TV. I paired it up with a Sonos sound bar and subwoofer and I am in entertainment heaven now.
customer_reviews.author: Chip Atl

customer_reviews.title: Almost a 5!
customer_reviews.text: Do not like the 'mouse pointer' remote. The one reaaaaaallly annoying thing is that when an input is not active when you turn on the set it is not smart enough to select the input when it becomes active. My Samsung handles this issue beautifully. The picture is very nice in low ambient light! One of the best pictures available.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing TV
customer_reviews.text: amazing picture quality, very highly customizable and programmable TV. you can leave picture quality on default or make it completely custom. im using a sound-bar, but TV speakers sound surprisingly well.... i must stress that picture quality and clarity is amazing. i am watching some of the movies over and noticing details that i havent seen before. (it has been only 1 week with this TV, i will update if anything changes)
customer_reviews.author: va

customer_reviews.title: Vertical line of dead pixels after 117 hours of screen on time
customer_reviews.text: First time LG TV buyer, completely disappointed in the quality. Had the unit for only 18 months, with only 117 total hours of screen on time, got a vertical line of dead pixels. Warranty only lasts 12 months so had to pay repair costs out of pocket. Cause diagnosis: hardware defect. New panel = $1,100, labor =$200. $1,300 to repair a TV I paid $1,500 for less than 2 years ago and watched less than 120 hours. BUYERS BEWARE! STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Lin

customer_reviews.title: At first I was skeptical, now I am a convert - you need 4K TV
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this TV for a while and it is off-the-charts amazing. I was able to save money and buy it on a Black Friday deal, and I can't be happier. I used to be someone who thought "Why get 4K" - until Netflix started to add 4K to their lineup. All of their latest shows are in 4K, I just finished Jessica Jones and the detail is crisp. I have been buying UHD (ultra high def) DVDs to add to my collection. I can't wait for the day that TV starts to add 4K content. The detail is the same wow factor you had when you went from standard TV to 720p/1080i.
customer_reviews.author: Philly

customer_reviews.title: Good picture at first, then developed green horizontal lines
customer_reviews.text: Good picture at first, then developed green horizontal lines that are quite visible on static white or reddish backgrounds. Not a quality expected for this money compared to Samsung or others. Would buy Samsung or Sony if knew of quality issues. My previous LCD TV lasted 10 years and was still working fine when I decided to replace it with bigger screen and "better" technology. Alas!
customer_reviews.author: Igor

customer_reviews.title: fabulous picture
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tv for about three weeks. The picture is incredible. The black is amazing and the other colors are magnificent. I did, however, turn off the energy saving option. It dimmed the picture to much. Outside of that minor adjustment, I do not have a single complaint. The delivery and setup were flawless. I connected cable and dvd player in minutes. Very pleased and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I never thought a TV could reproduce deep blacks and vivid colors the way a plasma could, but this OLED TV totally can. I haven't tried out the 4K potential yet, but even on 1080p input it's outstanding. If you have the means, I highly suggest picking one up :) PS I think for the money, the 55 inch display would be a way better value.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Amazing picture, very easy controls, everything I've watched has been perfect. The sound is impressive too, I've yet to had a moment where I'm watching at lower volumes and struggled to make the vocals out. Glad I made the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: I. Fairless

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous colors
customer_reviews.text: It's like when hi-def first came out, and we all stared at the TVs playing nature documentaries. Going to 4k is nice but the HDR is amazing. Spending hours watching HDR on YouTube, Amazon and Netflix. Wall mounting is pretty easy. Just be aware that it attaches very low on the TV. If you can afford it, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great TV!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this tv about two years, I think, and we love it! The picture quality is outstanding. The smart features are great and it even has a pixel refresher. It's extremely thin (about the thickness of two US quarters stacked) and the stand is made to look like it's floating. I can't say enough about it, it's just a great TV.
customer_reviews.author: S. H.

customer_reviews.title: Burn on TV
customer_reviews.text: TV was great for a while and I thought I would be the lucky one to avoid burn on the TV. But recently with all that is going on in the world, I have had the news on a lot which has caused the logo to burn onto the screen. Very disappointed as this TV lasted a long time without getting it. Then I watch the news for two weeks and get it ? Very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: I'll never go to the theater again.
customer_reviews.text: It's the most amazing and beautiful thing I've ever seen, and I'm a father of three.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: TRASH DO NOT BUY THIS TV
customer_reviews.text: Trash don’t buy OLED from LG, burn in has become such a problem LG no longer honors repairs or replacements
customer_reviews.author: Asura1117

customer_reviews.title: What a beautiful TV, highly suggested
customer_reviews.text: What a beautiful TV, highly suggested. Based on other reviews I found this to be an optimal buy. I own a apple TV so I don't need all the added features of the newer models also I have a 7.1 surround system so the added audio features are not a plus for me. For the price and features this is a must own.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great smart TV
customer_reviews.text: The input system for other devices is very intuitive & you can edit the input title to show the device attached rather than wondering what is HDMI this or that. The picture is excellent and you can change the picture style on the fly for different events.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Schackman

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed with picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I read a ton of reviews before buying this TV so I thought I was in the clear to buy a TV online. Never again. The picture quality for a TV of this price and “OLED” is trash. I’ve had people come over to my house and ask what’s wrong with the TV. My 2009 Sony TV was the same quality. Don’t even try to watch sports, which is what I wanted the most. This TV sucks. Sorry LG.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Cabla

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I Love this tv! The picture quality is incredible.. The television design is also incredible. The remote is fantastic. The UI is very good. Everything 5 stars about this TV, would absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Picture is crisp like cray. OLED + 4K <3
customer_reviews.text: Got it for $1600. Dang, the OLED pane takes whatever you’ll watch to another level. I’ve been mostly watching stuff with my Apple TV 4K (I enabled straight from the beginning the HDR mode). I could spend hours watching it.. it’s just gorgeous. The remote does the job, maybe too complex as you can point at the screen with it. Having a simple TV seems impossible in 2018 though.
customer_reviews.author: Jim'

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding picture
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding picture. Never thought I would like a smart TV but this is fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: OLED panels subject to become faulty quickly.
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars to 3 stars, due to the fact that the OLED panels going bad after just one year of use. This made portions of the screen appear noticeably dimmer than the other portions, which degrades the overall picture quality. LG did not offer any support for this. Buyer beware, avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: The black levels are perfect, and make it hard for me to go ...
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is mind-blowing, coming from an older LED HDTV. The black levels are perfect, and make it hard for me to go back to any other kind of screen as I now notice the blacks aren't as good as the LG OLED.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Mejia

customer_reviews.title: save your money. but TCL
customer_reviews.text: Had this for over a year now. TV is working OK, no complaints there. However the TV quality (picture quality, connectivity, ability to download new apps etc) is pathetic. I have a TCL for my other room which hands down is superior in every aspect. Stay away from this TV, buy TCL instead.
customer_reviews.author: Venks727

customer_reviews.title: Picture is black after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Almost 2 years to the day, and the picture is completely black when I turn it on. Looking it up online, and it's a common problem. Buyer beware. Up to this point, I have been very happy with the TV for movies and games.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McCord

customer_reviews.title: Best TV I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive picture and quality. Best TV I ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: DKE

customer_reviews.title: outstanding, but...reasons to wait
customer_reviews.text: outstanding, state of the art, not just 4k, its the new tech: OLED-no backlight, etc. Now just have to wait until broadcasts come in at 4k (still not all 1080i yet...up scaling 480i and lower.. 1990's tech... is ok, not great)
customer_reviews.author: John LoTello

customer_reviews.title: Bea-u-tiful
customer_reviews.text: If you need to upgrade to a 4K unit I don’t think there’s anything better than the LG. There are many oled TVs that are cheaper but the picture quality is just not there.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: World's best TV
customer_reviews.text: This is my second OLED, upgraded from the 55" to the 65". At first it did take some getting used to. The screen seemed overwhelming at times and my eyes felt strained. That only lasted a few days and watching a movie on this thing is a great experience. Even better, the price for the 65" on Amazon seems to keep dropping...dropped over $300 since I bought on August 3. Excellent investment for the house. Don't think you'll regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Daren Randy Brake

customer_reviews.title: Best TV screen I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Best TV screen I've ever seen. No issue with screen burn - it has screen saver. Just need to be aware that screen saver does not work when pausing DVR playback as mini clock is considered as changing screen. For sound improvement added YAS-207 soundbar. Contrary to some reviews it has Dolby Atmos. Package delivered on time with factory warranty (already registered with LG).
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I finally upgraded our old LG LED to this one. It's beautiful! I'm not exaggerating. It's hard to explain how nice the colors look when we're watching our HD programs. So far, it's been worth it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gaming experience
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, excellent, excellent picture quality. I never realized how important black levels were until this tv. Gaming on this thing is great, the color, the contrast, the crisp sharp image is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: BlueDemon224470

customer_reviews.title: Best TV yet!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture quality is the first thing we noticed. Love this smart tv! It has a vast array of features, like the ability to connect via Bluetooth to a sound system. We paired ours with an Amazon Fire HD, and couldn’t be happier with everything we can now view. Bye-bye cable!
customer_reviews.author: Samm

customer_reviews.title: Buy this TV
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, worth every penny. I've honestly never been so excited about a TV before but this one is incredible. Arrived very well packaged and earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Awesome TV!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because of it's high ratings. We had an LG SMART TV (3D) and even though it wasn't that old decided to upgrade. We are extremely happy with this TV.
customer_reviews.author: SRC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing TV, love everything about it.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this TV. The color and picture quality are amazing. Whether I'm playing games or watching movies I am amazed at how good it looks. Blacks are on point, bright colors and super thin. Wish they could make them smaller. One day I'll purchase the 65" too.
customer_reviews.author: FutureMr2

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this TV
customer_reviews.text: 2 years and 2 months after purchase the TV stopped working. TV worked fine, turned it off and it wouldn't turn back on. Out of warranty, I called Best Buy to send a technician to repair it. Diagnosis is that screen display is burned out and quoted $2000 for part to replace. They told me this is a common problem for this model TV. So I have a $2500 TV that lasted 26 months. BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: J. Litsey

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better ( in my opinion)
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I expected more but the picture although good appears not to be as sharp as promised for an OLED TV. After an Amazon installation ,I had to hire an ATT technician to finish wiring .
customer_reviews.author: mannaalso2

customer_reviews.title: Sound does not synch with picture
customer_reviews.text: In many ways it is a good tv. However, the sound is delayed relative to the picture, and it seems to get worse each day. Watching people speak, and the corresponding sound come out a second or more later makes this tv largely unwatchable. Update - Per another comment, I disabled “AV Sync Adjustment”, which improved the sound synchronization for internal speakers, at least for now. Still does not synch well with a recommended external LG sound bar. TV is also slow to turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: outstanding image quality, poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: This TV is literally 14 months old and it is showing all sorts of issues just after the warranty expired. If you look up your issue you see thousands of posts of people with similar issues. They have a beautiful panel with outstanding image but the quality control seems to be lacking. They also don't stand behind their product , very poor support and costumer service. This might be our last LG TV.
customer_reviews.author: Leandro Henrique Amaral

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice and sleek
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and sleek. Picture is fantastic. The Magic remote is so much easier to use than norml remotes, espeically for typing things in. Took a little bit to get my cable remote to pair with it so I could use the Magic remote and the cable remote for Sonos but was finally able to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: you will never like a non OLED one
customer_reviews.text: if you buy this television, you will never like a non OLED one... I feel ashamed that I spent so much money on a television but I'm always in front of it amazed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great picture though couldn't be happier ant the price point ...
customer_reviews.text: Only thing that I found was I can't seem to get both internal and external speakers to work at the same time. I see were you can make the selection but the internals never come on when trying to use both. Great picture though couldn't be happier ant the price point is perfect and most likely will only get better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, it really is phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: It’s absolutely phenomenal. Having had quality Samsung TVs previously I can say I’m glad I jumped ship to LG. Not to insult Samsung, they make some great TVs, but this tv is just... well... brilliant. Buy it, enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Nicholas Howe

customer_reviews.title: Screen Burn if you play video games
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for two years and there is screen burn all over it. This is using Xbox one. I can see little maps and menus icons burned into the screen. If you just watch movies or whatever, this will be great. Just don’t buy this if you play video games. Two grand thrown away in this now junk.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This a beautiful model, the product overall and the picture quality. True black, brilliant color, HDR/4K looks fantastic (buy a high speed HDMI cable if you’re using something like an Apple TV). Regular HD cable TV benefits greatly as. Lovely design, thin, metal glass. Solidly built. Looks great from the front. The translucent stand really cleans up the whole the whole thing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. You will have to do some tweaking to ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. You will have to do some tweaking to get the picture to look good but when you do, you will be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Weiler

customer_reviews.title: Amazing clarity and depth of color
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this product a month so can't really give it too many high points yet. However I am stunned by the picture. Amazing clarity and depth of color. The screen depth is absolutely incredible at about 1/4" thickness which of course makes the whole relatively light. Will revisit this post next year with more information.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff L.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful picture, perfect for my Xbox one x and ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful picture, perfect for my Xbox one x and soon my ps4 pro. Saw a lot of complaints about the sound and people saying you need to buy a sound bar but I have no complaints it’s got a nice bass to it on its own, the only negative sound wise I’d say is trying to watch something on low is kinda hard it’s either too soft on low or too bassy on louder
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive but for a good reason.
customer_reviews.text: Blacks are blacks. Whites are white. Contrast is exceptional, so is the detail on the images and all colors very vivid. Very expensive but for a good reason.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo R. Vitaver

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful picture quality
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic Oled tv. The picture really is so much better on an oled. I don’t think that you can find a better tv at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Isackson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Lovvvvve this TV. It's beautiful. WebOS is so fun and easy to use. I wish the TV had a 5th HDMI instead of all the USB ports (I think there are 3? Like...why?) Overall very happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic OLED screen. Can be driven at 4K@60 or 1080p@120 for the PC people out there.
customer_reviews.author: Marcel

customer_reviews.title: What a view!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. What a picture. The HDR makes such a difference. I'm very pleased I went with OLED.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Atwood

customer_reviews.title: Great picture!!!
customer_reviews.text: Even my wife is impressed. She commented on great the colors were. Can’t wait to see 4K movies on Amazon and Netflix. We have it connected through our surround sound system so I cannot speak to the audio of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation. Only complaint is that the "source" button ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit far exceeded our expectations. Slim, elegant, and outstanding picture clarity and color. Easy installation. Only complaint is that the "source" button on the remote is not readily recognizable. It looks like a computer mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence J.F.

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend and I both love our new TV
customer_reviews.text: Boyfriend and I both love our new TV! It is the best out there for the price (we did some research).
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: I love it! It's the nicest television I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It's the nicest television I've ever owned. I bought a Bose soundbar to go with it as the factory speakers are a little weak. But that's the norm for televisions.
customer_reviews.author: David Whitsell

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this tv
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage tv. We’ve had it 9 months and there is a giant green spot in the middle and burn in on the screen. Will never buy another lg tv again
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Reznik

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: I had done a lot of research before buying this TV. It exceeded my expectations. The remote leaves a lot to be desired
customer_reviews.author: Nel

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful picture.
customer_reviews.text: So far this TV has been everything advertised. Beautiful picture.
customer_reviews.author: Walter P. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Awful Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Horrible customer service. Burn-in and panel discoloration happened 6 months after the one year warranty expired and LG wanted to charge me about the same as the original purchase price for a panel repair. Buy an extended warranty or prepare for absolutely no help from LG
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Fichera

customer_reviews.title: Great picture but a little dark.
customer_reviews.text: Great picture. However, it is a little dark. Had to play with the settings to get it right for the room. Otherwise its a great tv for the price. Probably best in a well lit room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful TV
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture quality. Have had zero issues with my referb.
customer_reviews.author: Otzen42

customer_reviews.title: Breathtaking image quality with excellent design.
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous TV. Best looking image I've ever seen on a TV. Features are easy and great to use. It looks great in the living room, too. Only downside is the price.
customer_reviews.author: John Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Best picture quality available!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend everyone to go out and get an OLED display. I was leaning towards the Sony 930E but once you see this TV in a store, you just can’t look at anything else. My only complaint is a small scratch in the back of the panel, I noticed it after I removed all the plastic. It’s no big deal, I’ll still sleep good at night.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Awesome picture
customer_reviews.text: Great tv. Picture quality is as expected - Incredible. Got it specifically to use with my new gaming pc to play games on max settings in 4k. Was not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Melzack

customer_reviews.title: BEST TV EVER, BEST 4K Quality and Great definitions on blacks and shadows......just amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: This by far is the best TV that I ever had. I bought this TV reading a lots of reviews, but one thing is reading the reviews and another to view and be amazed by the quality, blacks, whites, shades, its just amazing. Its a little bit expensive, but worth every dollar. At this moment I'm trying 4K content and DTS.....is just AMAZING. LG puts the Television to another level with this TV.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful picture. Colors are amazing with OLED and am extremely happy to finally be able to buy one. WebOS is nice and responsive on these TVs even if I dont use it much. TV had an update shortly after purchase from 3.5 to 4.x that took over an hour which worried me a bit but all was fine after the update.
customer_reviews.author: Reynn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing TV
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal Picture. Great TV all around. Surprisingly better sound than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Penguins

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled with the LG OLED!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We are thrilled!! The picture quality is amazing!!! It was almost like going from black & white TV to color. My only regret is not buying it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a beautiful thing to look at whether it's turned on or ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful thing to look at whether it's turned on or not. Picture quality is superb. It makes everything you watch look better than it did on your old set.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful! Love it
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful! Love it! Sometimes has a 'sync problem' with audio and video and thankfully, there is an adjustment for that.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Williams

product_meta.title: LG Electronics OLED65B7A 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart OLED TV (2017 Model)
product_meta.description:
Size:65-Inch| Style:TV

Perfect Black. Intense Color. Every Detail Matters. Behold movies and more from the most popular providers, brought to life with intense cinematic colors against the ultimate backdrop of perfect black. Discover the most HDR entertainment choices, including support for premium Dolby Vision, delivered via the intuitive webOS Smart TV platform.

Disclaimer: Dolby and the double-D symbol are registered trademarks of Dolby Laboratories.Dolby Vision is a trademark of Dolby Laboratories.

Disclaimer: Please check with content providers for required bandwidth to stream videos. Smart service on product is subject to change. Some apps that appear on the screen image may not be preinstalled; Internet connection is required for download.

Amazon.com is not a sponsor of this promotion. Except as required by law, Amazon.com Gift Cards ("GCs") cannot be transferred for value or redeemed for cash. GCs may be used only for purchases of eligible goods at Amazon.com or certain of its affiliated websites. For complete terms and conditions, see www.amazon.com/gc-legal. GCs are issued by ACI Gift Cards LLC, a Washington limited liability company. All Amazon Registered, Copyrights and Trademarks are IP of Amazon.com, Inc. or its affiliates. No expiration date or service fees.
feature_bullets: Dimensions (w x H x D): TV without stand: 57.1" x 32.7" x 1.9", TV with stand: 57.1" x 34.7" x 8.9"
Smart functionality gives you access to your favorite apps and content using webOS 3.5. CONNECTIVITY : Wi-Fi Built In 802.11ac
Pairs 4K Ultra HD picture clarity with the contrast, color, and detail of High Dynamic Range (HDR) for the most lifelike picture
Individually lit OLED pixels achieve the ultimate contrast for outstanding picture quality
OLED does not require a backlight giving it deep blacks and making it extremely thin
Inputs: 4 HDMI, 3 USB, 1 RF, 1 Composite, Component Shared w/ Composite, 1 Ethernet, 1 Optical, 1 RS232C (Mini Jack). Smart TV Operating System-webOS 3.5

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars380 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
